content:
This is my second purchase of the Beauty of Joseon Centella Asiatica Calming Mask.

My experiences with this:
It does calm my face and it is moisturizing.
It doesn't burn or irritate my sensitive skin.
I like that it has little or no overpowering or noticeable scent even after I am done with the mask.
After I remove it from my face my face is not sticky where i have to wash my face before sleeping
I like the paper that the mask is on because it makes it easier to open up the mask from the packet and put it on my face.
I like the its a 10 pack and that is a value. I get my husband another brand face mask and its sold in single packets only so its really inconvenient to remember to order them.
These masks is so good that i would definitely look into trying their other products.

title: [Beauty of Joseon] Centella Asiatica Calming Mask 10ea
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
content: This product feels really nice. I’ve been using it once a week and it’s really hydrating. The first time I left it on for about 20ish minutes, and felt that my skin was left slightly more hydrated, but nothing a serum couldn’t do. The next time I left the mask on for 30+ minutes and definitely felt that my skin was left more hydrated than before, and it seemed to last well into the next day. Centella is known to be a calming, soothing compound that reduces redness, but I don’t think there is enough of it in this product to get its full benefits. When using a centella mask, I want the highest amount possible to reduce the redness in my skin. However, it is pretty hydrating. I will be trying out other mask brands, but I don’t know if I plan to repurchase this again.

content: I use sheet masks daily. They are really good at hydrating and nourishing my skin, which is fair and sensitive. I have bought this sheet mask 2-3x and it is honesty my first or second favorite. It is so calming and leaves my skin looking amazing. It reduces redness in my face, too. It’s a high quality mask and $23 for 10 sheets is a steal. There is plenty of product in the envelope so I put it in the fridge and re-use within 24 hours. BOJ also has the best Gua Sha (gwalsa) out there, too, which works well with their products. It’s porcelain and not jade. The shape works better for massaging my face (and body). Highly recommend both. Yes, BOJ is one of my favorite brands. I use several of their products. The essence and dynasty cream are wonderful.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Serum Propolis and Niacinamide Hydrating Facial Soothing Moisturizer for Irritated Uneven Skin Tone, Korean Skin Care 30ml, 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2025
content:
I'll admit that I'm a middle-aged dude who, until recently, thought skincare involved splashing some water on my face and calling it a day. But thanks to my amazing girlfriend (who's way ahead of me in the skincare game), I've discovered the wonders of K-beauty, starting with this Beauty of Joseon Glow Serum. It's a revelation.

Here's why I'm glowing about this serum:

Hydration without the Heavies: This serum is like water for my skin. It absorbs quickly, leaving my face hydrated and refreshed without any greasy residue. This is a welcome change for someone who's used to that tight, dry feeling due to living at a high altitude.

Glow-Up Achieved: I've been using this serum for a few weeks now, and I can honestly say my skin looks brighter and healthier. It's got a subtle glow that I haven't seen in years, and even my girlfriend has commented on how much better my skin looks.

Soothes and Calms: I have sensitive skin prone to redness, but this serum has been incredibly gentle. It seems to calm any irritation and leave my skin feeling soothed.

Lightweight and Layerable: The lightweight texture absorbs quickly, making it perfect for layering under moisturizer and sunscreen. It doesn't feel heavy or greasy, which is a big plus.

Intriguing Ingredients: The combination of propolis and niacinamide is fascinating. I'm not a skincare expert (yet!), but I've learned that these ingredients are known for their soothing, brightening, and anti-inflammatory properties.

A Few Minor Considerations: While I'm thoroughly impressed with this serum, there are a couple of things to keep in mind based on other reviews:

Slight Stickiness: Some users mentioned a slight stickiness immediately after the application. I've noticed this, but it disappears quickly as the serum absorbs.

Not a Miracle Cure: While this serum has improved my skin's hydration and overall appearance, it's not a magic wand that will erase years of neglect overnight. Consistent use and a good overall skincare routine are key.

Overall: If you're looking for a hydrating, brightening, and soothing serum that's gentle on sensitive skin, the Beauty of Joseon Glow Serum is a fantastic choice. It's been a game-changer for my skin, and I highly recommend it to anyone, especially fellow middle-aged guys new to the skincare world (and taking recommendations from their awesome girlfriends).

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Serum Propolis and Niacinamide Hydrating Facial Soothing Moisturizer for Irritated Uneven Skin Tone, Korean Skin Care 30ml, 1 fl.oz

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Serum Propolis and Niacinamide Hydrating Facial Soothing Moisturizer for Irritated Uneven Skin Tone, Korean Skin Care 30ml, 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2025
content: Admittedly I ordered the Glow Serum full of hope but with low expectations. I am in my 60’s and have mild rosacea (redness) and extremely sensitive skin. There are very few products I can use so my skincare routine is limited. I started using the Glow Serum a month ago and I am shocked at how it has improved the look and feel of my skin. I put this on after cleansing and it feels amazing. I experienced none of the reactions I usually do from products such as itching, burning, and red bumps. I follow with the one moisturizer I can use morning and evening. When I wake up in the morning my skin looks and feels calm and yes, it’s glowing! It has never looked this good! I can even leave the house make up free now. I ordered some for my 35 year old daughter and she loves it too. When my overly expensive moisturizer starts running low I think I will try the Dynasty Cream and will hope for a similar experience. The other benefit of BOJ is the products are reasonably priced. I have already purchased another bottle even though I still have half remaining after a month of use because I don’t ever want to be without it. I hope they never stop making this serum!

—-
THIS was the solution to my dry skin. I don’t know how or why it’s been so effective on me, but if you suffer from dryness after your skincare routine, I’d highly suggest trying this toner. I've been using the Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Essence Water for a few weeks, and I have mixed feelings about it. The toner is lightweight and does a good job of hydrating my dry, dull skin. The ginseng essence gives a refreshing feel, and it's great for both men and women looking for a moisturizing skin care option.

content: The product was purchased via Amazon under House of Joseon. This is the real thing, and I'm very pleased with it so far. It does not break or damage my sensitive skin barrier. Huge win for me. I use it in perhaps an unconventional manner. I put it on a cotton pad after doing a double cleanse. Afterward, I put some more onto my hands and pat in the additional toner. Wait about a minute and put on eye serum and then face serum, followed by my moisturizer. This is my night routine. In the morning, I do a gentle facial cleanser, followed by this ginseng toner, by patting it with my hands. Then, eye and face serums, moisturizer, and finally, SPF. Loving the toner!!

Even though I haven’t seen any noticeable improvements yet, it’s a refreshing addition to my routine, especially in the mornings. I’ll keep using it and hope to see results over time, but for now, it’s more about the experience than immediate effects.

title: Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Essence Water Hydrating Face Toner for Dry, Dull Skin. Korean Moisturizing Skin Care for Men and Women 150ml, 5 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
content:
I really do not do reviews but in this case I feel like I have to, to warn people have sensitive skin to be careful if they want to try this skincare line. I ordered my first beauty of Joseon last year I got the ginseng toner, the cleanser and the serum that goes with it. Up on using the product I felt that my skin is healthy and glowing and clear then it have ever been. And to make it clear I have a hyper sensitive skin and on top of that I have eczema so my skin can flare up anytime if it wants to or if I use something that irritates it. Since I use the products for a year everything was doing fine everything was perfect I'm loving the product there's no problem with it my skin is loving it not until the beginning of this year all of a sudden my face broke out. My face started to itch I thought it was just itchy but when I look at it on the mirror I see some redness on my skin and some rash, so basically my face was flaring up but I did not blame it to the skincare that I was using because like I said a year prior everything was perfect so I thought it's just my skin doing its thing and it's going to go away. So I stopped using the skin care line until my face was fully healed so that was about June when my face finally healed from the flare-up that I had from the beginning of the this year. I didn't use the toner because I ran out, but I still have the oil based cleanser and I'm being using it on and off and my face is okay it didn't flare up it no allergic reaction or anything like that. decided to reorder the toner Plus the light vitamin C serum and got delivered yesterday, so I opened up the new bottle of toner and the vitamin C light serum and use it exactly at 9:40 p.m.. but when 3:00 a.m. came left corner of my lips was kind of itchy so I checked it out on the mirror and it was red and I was praying in my heart that it wasn't from the toner and the term that I used prior before going to work. But as the morning progress the T-Zone area on my face flared up now it have a full-blown allergic reaction it have this small type of rash and it's red and it's itchy. So I am sad to say I am discontinuing using the toner and serum. before knowing that the cause of my previous allergic reaction was this skin care line I reordered the snail serum as well because I was using that last year and I really like the results. Now I'm sad because not only did I feel like I wasted my money now I don't know what to do with this brand new products especially the snail serum that is going to be delivered tomorrow.
So in conclusion for all of the people who have sensitive skin and their skin can be easily irritated please be careful before buying this or any type of skin care. Just make myself clear I'm not saying the product is not good because like I said I love the product and it worked on me last year when i got it.

title: Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Essence Water Hydrating Face Toner for Dry, Dull Skin. Korean Moisturizing Skin Care for Men and Women 150ml, 5 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
content: I've never been into toner, makeup or KBeauty but I'm never skipping skincare again. My skin was uneven, pigmented and a little dry from too much sun. So based on the good reviews I thought I'd give this a try. After about two weeks of using this twice daily, I can't believe how bright and plump my skin looks and feels. You do have to get used to the earthy smell and the texture is sort of slippery and sits on your skin but once it dries it's weightless. I top it off with Jumiso All Day Vit brightening serum and started both at the same time so tbh I'm not sure if it's the toner, serum or combination. In any case it works. Note that it does not lighten your skin just evens out darkish areas so you can still see my freckles but for some reason my skin glows. :) It comes in a cool thick plastic bottle which makes you wonder why Asian packaging is so awesome yet affordable.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2024
content:
I dont usually write product reviews but hopefully someone takes this into account when looking to purchase - this product contains NIACINAMIDE which can cause allergic reactions like it did for me. Obviously I wouldnt have purchased if i knew this was a possible side effect, but even just about 30 seconds after use my skin became inflamed and I started to feel a burning sensation. The more white parts you can see in the photos are my natural skin tone and this is 2 minutes after applying as directed.

PLEASE DONT USE IF YOU HAVE A KNOWN HISTORY OF NIACIN REACTIONS !!

Disappointed because I love trying new skin products but im not sure why a company would use an ingredient that has inflaming properties on a facial skincare product. Niacin flush is a well documented side affect for a large portion of the population, so please be aware of the affect this could have on your skin.

title: Beauty of Joseon Apricot Blossom Peeling Gel Soft Exfoliating Face and Body Scrub Dead Skin Cells Remover for All Skin Types, Korean Skincare for Men Women, 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
content:
I’m a Master Esthetician and skincare junkie, no rookie to aggressive product or treatments. I know what I’m doing, and I’ve NEVER had this happen after using a product once.

I used this enzyme last night for the first time and followed it with my usual routine, no other new products. I woke up with this rash on both cheeks and forehead. I know this product is the culprit because I only used it on my face, whereas all my other products I carry down my neck and chest. My neck and chest are clear.

I reviewed the ingredients before purchasing, I know I’m not allergic to any of them. A gommage(enzyme exfoliant) is typically less aggressive than a physical face scrub, so maybe I got a bad batch? No other harsh products were used in the same routine.

My professional opinion? Don’t buy this, if it’s irritating the skin of someone who works in the industry then theres something amiss. I hope I can return but obviously I did open and use it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024
content: I couldn’t believe how effective this stuff is. On clean, damp skin, you apply it with a gentle circular motion, avoiding the eye area. ALL the dead, dry skin will come off in your hand! It’s like a chemical peel without the pain and inconvenience. If you have actinic keratosis (dry, flaky patches) your face, this will smooth them out. It’s no substitute for a dermatologist, and those patches can turn into skin cancer, but it’s hard to cover them even with concealer. I use this twice a week, I’m 65, and the sun damage on my face is pretty bad. This is much gentler than a gritty scrub, and works so much better. My skin is so soft afterwards. Plus, you can’t beat the price!

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
content:
I have never left an Amazon review for anything, but I feel compelled because I couldn't love this product more. I am 31 and I've taken pretty poor care of my skin up to this point (shameful/embarrassing, I know). I bought a couple of other Korean skincare items on a whim -- and added this to my cart as well, because I figured exfoliating would allow the other products to work better.

This stuff is like a time machine in a bottle! It's literally taking years off of my face!! I've used it twice now, and each time, I'm so impressed at how soft my face feels.

As soon as I start rubbing it in, small balls of dead skin start sloughing off. It's exactly like using one of those cheese graters on your feet during a pedicure (gross, but true). I find it very satisfying, like "YES, TAKE THAT DEAD SKIN WITH YOU!"

I do feel a bit of redness and warmth after each use, and I am sure to moisturize very well afterwards.

I don't think I ever want to be without this product. It's straight magic. Will be buying again and again.

title: Beauty of Joseon Apricot Blossom Peeling Gel Soft Exfoliating Face and Body Scrub Dead Skin Cells Remover for All Skin Types, Korean Skincare for Men Women, 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025
content:
The Overview:
The Beauty of Joseon Apricot Blossom Peeling Gel has become my holy grail for skin exfoliation. It's not your typical scrub; this gel is uniquely formulated to provide an exceptional exfoliating experience for both face and body.

The Good:
Unique Exfoliation: Unlike scrubs with harsh granules, this peeling gel uses small, textured elements that gently lift off dead skin cells without any abrasiveness. The sensation is akin to watching dead skin peel away, leaving your skin feeling rejuvenated.
Efficacy: After using this product, my skin feels as smooth and clean as post-Sonicare brushing, but for the face and body. It's gentle yet effective, making it perfect for sensitive skin types or those who prefer a less aggressive approach to exfoliation.
Gentle Formula: The inclusion of natural ingredients like Apricot Blossom extract adds a nourishing aspect to the exfoliation process, enhancing hydration and leaving skin not just exfoliated but also soothed.
Versatility: Suitable for both face and body, this product maximizes utility, making it a staple in my skincare routine.

The Not-So-Good:
Really, It's Hard to Find Flaws: If I had to nitpick, I might mention that the texture might not appeal to everyone since it's different from traditional scrubs, but that's more about preference than a flaw.

Overall:
This exfoliating gel from Beauty of Joseon has transformed my skincare routine. It's now my go-to product for that clean, smooth skin feeling without the irritation that sometimes comes with other exfoliants. If you're seeking a must-try exfoliator that feels like a gentle yet thorough cleanse, this is it.

Pros:
Innovative texture for effective, gentle exfoliation
Leaves skin feeling incredibly smooth and clean
Suitable for sensitive skin
Works for both face and body

Cons:
The unique feel might not appeal to everyone accustomed to traditional scrubs

Conclusion:
If you're in the market for an exfoliator that feels like a treat rather than a chore, the Beauty of Joseon Apricot Blossom Peeling Gel should be at the top of your list. It's like giving your skin the Sonicare treatment, and I can't recommend it enough for anyone looking to elevate their skincare game.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
content: I use this after washing my face in the shower in the evening, rubbing it in gently until I feel tiny granules of residue have formed. Then I wash it off and immediately apply my preferred active (in my case, the retinoid adapalene). I find it gives the retinoid especially good skin access, since it removes dead cells. A benefit of this exfoliant being extra gentle is that it means I’m not having to apply my retinoid over irritated skin, which in my case means I’m able to repeat this routine every night. It’s not recommended to use it that frequently, and maybe you really shouldn’t, but that’s what I do regardless and my skin looks really smooth and pretty. Some people’s skin can handle it and I’m one of them.

title: Beauty of Joseon Low pH Rice Face and Body Cleansing Bar Soap Gentle Moisturizing Skin Clenaser For Sensiive Skin Korean Skin Care 100g
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
content: I have sensitive, reactive, dehydrated and normal to dry skin. I easily break out when my skin is overstripped or the barrier is compromised in any way. For years I have been unable to use any cleanser that is foaming or sudsing in any way and have had to use only lotion type cleansers. I thought I would try this as I love other products from this line and the price was very reasonable. I am so surprised to say that I have been able to use this twice a day for so long that I went through an entire bar and bought two more! It foams nicely, and I have missed being able to use a foamy cleanser. The lather/foam it creates is thick and sift, and while it does leave my face a bit dry and tight, it has caused zero irritation or compromise to my skin barrier. I always follow with toners, essences, serums, and moisturizers regardless of my cleanser, so the initial tightness is not bothersome. While it does dry a bit, it doesn’t seem to actually dehydrate my skin. Best of all, it keeps my skin clear and bright better than almost any cleanser I have ever used. I am so shocked by this bar, not at all what I expect from this type of soap. So pleased!!

content: These serums are so so so good. I love skin care and am always trying new brands and products, very experienced and cosmetology licensed. I love these. The way the main ingredient in the products are the first or second listed is excellent. The price is a great way to try these, and they have a gorgeous texture. No silicones yet glide on as if they do. From the ingredients it appears they are not full of fillers at all. Great texture yet absorb quickly, leaving your skin feeling plumped. I've noticed a big change in my pore size and blackheads which is my biggest skin concern. The first couple of weeks I didn't notice a change but then all of a sudden it was like night and day. Will be purchasing large bottles of these. The one I can do without is the green serum for redness, I do not have that as an issue so I will not be purchasing that one. I also bought the rice milk toner and love it as well. I am very interested in trying the eye serum and the masks. Great brand, this has sold me.

title: Beauty of Joseon Serum Line (Hanbang Serum Discovery Kit)
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2024
content:
I want to say that I truly love these products. My skin's been relatively decent forever but my hormones have been terrible lately. I woke up and it was almost like my skin's barrier was gone and I kept getting cystic acne. For reference, I'm 26, and this was completely out of the blue. However, I've always had overly red cheeks (not rosacea but just thin skin), I thought maybe there'd be WAY to change that. Nope! The Glow Deep Serum and the Calm Serum changed the game! My face is evening out by the day. And the GLOW. I told my best friend, "I literally wear a full face of makeup every day of my life and I truly love my skin and I feel like I really almost don't need it. This is CRAZY."

First pic: No Makeup the lip product is a lip mask from Bath and body works
Second Pic: Makeup but you can see the glow from underneath AND you can see how hydrated my skin is and the texture improving. Unfortunate I didn't take any pictures when my skin was dying but. YES. get this.

My full routine:

Double Cleanse:
- Beekman 1802's Milk Wash Exfoliating Jelly (Cleanse alone with this and if you have sensitive skin you will fight me later. My skin hated me at first until I combined the Cetaphil but it wasn't nearly as bad as aveeno's "sensitive" skin line. That brand and facewash is TERRIBLE.
- Cetaphil Gentle Cleanser (My fav and so cheap)
Toner:
-The Saem "Drop Be" (Purchased when I went to Busan last winter but you can find it on Ebay)
Serums: I use all four of these- I introduced two then four at a time to address problem areas.
Face Mask:
-Mediheal ( My favorites are the Collagen ones and the WaterMide as they don't irritate my sensitive AF skin at all)
Eye Mask:
-Florence (the purple ones for undereye bags) Absolutely obsessed because I have terrible
undereye bags thanks to genetics. The definitely help with puffiness and discoloration. I've been using them for months now.
Lip scrub/Lip Mask:
-Bath and body works vanilla (so good I want a different one though since I like brand exploration but it's SO hydrating and it is great for a no-makeup clean girl look)
Barrier Cream/Skin life changer x2:
-ETUDE Soon Jung 2x Barrier Cream Hypoallergenic

title: Beauty of Joseon Serum Line (Hanbang Serum Discovery Kit)
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
content:
I bought the Beauty by Joseon Serum Discovery Kit and I am glad I didn't spend the money on the larger individual ones. My take on the four included are: 2 out of three of them are very sticky and feel terrible on the skin. I would absolutely pass on the Glow Deep Serum because of the tacky sticky grossness of it. I dont care how good it is, it never absorbs and just sits on top of your skin. The second worse was the Revive serum, it was also very sticky and never really dries or absorbs into the skin.

The two that I liked were the Green Tea and Panthenol as well as the Glow Serum with Propolis and Niacinamide. The green tea one absorbed nicely into the skin. The regular glow serum with propolis and Niacinamide was also pretty nice. It had a little bit of a tacky feeling but absorbed nicely into the skin after a little while.

None of them broke me out or made my skin turn red with a patch test on my arm. I would reorder the ladder two. None of them had much of a smell at all either which I really liked. I cant stand fragrances so that was a plus.

title: Beauty of Joseon Serum Line (Hanbang Serum Discovery Kit)
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2024
content:
Well, at first I tried the glow serum and really liked it and it seemed to have done some good effects on my face. Then a couple days later I tried the snail serum and the next day I had SO many closed comedones all over my face! At first I thought it was just something I had ate, but then I researched it and found out it was closed comedones (basically where oil and dirt get trapped under your pores and create bumps). Plus I never break out from food.
And it took almost a week to get rid of it.
So I suggest you buy them separately...and the size well it's super tiny so yeah.

content:
I am having a very tough time with my skin. It's aging at a rapid rate. I have combination skin, it doesn't know whether it's oily or dry depending on the week. I've heard so many good things about Korean skincare.. so I MUST TRY IT!
First off I've used a different product each time, trying to figure out which one will suit me so I can buy that ONE next time. I will say it definitely hydrates, it's mild-moderately sticky. Texture is smooth/matte. And it's slightly heavy. I've noticed an increase in my blackheads. (I am one who cannot leave zits and such just chilling on my face. So I've been picking more. ) There weren't directions with the product--just labeling for the ingredients. But I'm guessing the soothing green tea one is best for my inflamed skin.

title: Beauty of Joseon Serum Line (Hanbang Serum Discovery Kit)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
content: All of these serums worked and I loved them. But I believe that there are much better serums out there than these. In this kit, the serums actually come very small and are used fairly quickly. Most of them are very great for sensitive skins and work well with texture and acne but there are much better serums that treat the same things that these do. I would use these if your just getting into skincare but if your looking for specific serums to treat specific things these are a waste of your time and money. They do all smell great though and have a great consistency and weight on the skin.

content: I love how easy this product melts my sunscreen and makeup, and it doesn’t strip my skin’s moisture barrier at all. date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025
content: This made me break out after several uses. The problem with so many Korean products is that they're really not appropriate for sensitive, acne-prone skin even if they're marketed for sensitive skin. That's been my experience.

title: Beauty of Joseon Radiance Cleansing Balm Makeup, Sunscreen, Pore Cleanser for Sensitive Acne Skin. Korean Skincare for Men and Women 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024
content:
About a year or two ago, my normally soft, supple and clear skin took a complete and total dive.

Unfortunately serving as a harbinger for the health problems underlying its condition.

And while I'm still knee deep in identifying all the moving parts of my health problems.

My hope was to at least be able to calm my wildly reactive skin at the surface level.

This luxurious cleansing balm breaks down the day's buildup and rinses so beautifully that I've used it for both face and body as all of the skin on this sweet body has become *practically* hydrophobic.

For the face, I use this as part of a double cleanse with a brilliant enzymatic rice powder that turns into this lovely marshmallow-y cleanser.

And finish with a rice cream moisturizer to seal in the feeling of gently exfoliated, baby soft skin.

Rice skincare has been an absolute game-changer for me and my dry, flaky, rosacea-prone, eczema-prone skin.

Hoping next to switch out my witch hazel and mineral sunscreen for a rice-based toner and rice-based sunscreen formulated for dry skin... yes, they do exist <3

K-beauty products for the win!

title: Beauty of Joseon Radiance Cleansing Balm Makeup, Sunscreen, Pore Cleanser for Sensitive Acne Skin. Korean Skincare for Men and Women 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2024
content: My first cleansing balm. It does a really great job getting everything off but I think as a result, it can be a little stripping if you're someone like me who doesn't really wear makeup. It's a solid choice and everything washes off easily without leaving any residue. This didn't break me out, but I did sometimes get the "squeaky clean" feeling after using this. I am someone who likes really massaging in my cleansing balms so that might play a role in it. It gets a lot of blackheads/clears my pores. It really does a good job getting everything, but since I'm not really wearing that much, this is a pass for me. I took this camping with me and it was the best thing for getting off the grime from camp/campfire smoke/all the layers of sunscreen though. If you need a heavy-duty cleansing balm, this is a great option.

The Beauty of Joseon Radiance Cleansing Balm is worth it. It melts into my skin, turning into a silky oil that effortlessly lifts off every bit of build up from the previous day.

What I love most is how my skin feels afterward—clean, soft, and not the least bit greasy. It’s gentle enough for my sensitive skin and doesn’t cause any irritation, which is always a concern for me. Plus, the jar is compact and comes with a spatula, so I never have to worry about dipping my fingers in.

This balm has quickly become a favorite in my skincare routine. If you’re looking for something that’s both effective and gentle, I can’t recommend it enough.

title: Beauty of Joseon Radiance Cleansing Balm Makeup, Sunscreen, Pore Cleanser for Sensitive Acne Skin. Korean Skincare for Men and Women 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2024
content:
I loved my Lilah B cleansing balm so much I was sad when they went out of business. The only thing was Lilah B had a strong fragrance added, but it was a beautiful fragrance so I didn't mind.

I haven't found one that matched that perfect feeling of spreading on my facial skin smoothly and then turning to a beautiful oil-like texture and then washing away cleanly. I'm sure they are out there, I just didn't find one that I liked or compared to LB. Until this Beauty of Joseon cleansing balm!

I do love everything BOJ, so I am biased :) but this cleansing balm goes on so beautifully, spreads easily, and turns to a gorgeous texture on my skin. Easy to wash away. No fragrance, which is great if you have sensitive skin.

I don't double cleanse in the morning - I use BOJ ginger cleansing oil, which I also love as it cleans my face without drying it out. But, when I wear sunscreen and/or makeup, I will double cleanse. I use this balm first and then follow up with their Green Plum cleansing gel.

I have slight rosacea-prone skin and this does not irritate it. In face, the BOJ line is helping my rosacea - in particular their green tea serum calms the redness (along with CosRx snail mucin -gross but effective!).

And the price is so reasonable like all of BOJ products.

I need to order backups!

Highly recommend.

title: Beauty of Joseon Revive Eye Serum with Retinal Niacinamide Correction for Puffy Eye Bags Fine Lines Dark Circles Wrinkles, Korean Skin Care 30ml, 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2025
content:
After I developed a handful of annoying milia bumps on my face, I revamped my skincare routine, which entails using only products that are non-pore–clogging (different from non-comedogenic!). A dermatologist recommended this eye cream for its moisturizing and non-pore–clogging abilities. She actually said while it was an eye cream, you could use on your whole face. I use one pump on my whole face morning and night

I don't know if it's the eye cream or the whole skincare revamp, but I've gotten a ridiculous amount of compliments on my skin. Two separate friends I hadn't seen in a couple of months asked me to send them instructions to my regimen! I chalk it up to three things: this eye cream for sure; Naked and Thriving's Renew night serum; and finishing my skincare routine with pure squalane oil to lock in the treatments.

This eye cream is a keeper for me. It's reasonably priced, feels really good on my skin, and it doesn't cause me any milia problems. I recommend it!

title: Beauty of Joseon Revive Eye Serum with Retinal Niacinamide Correction for Puffy Eye Bags Fine Lines Dark Circles Wrinkles, Korean Skin Care 30ml, 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2024
content:
I bought this product back in July of 2024 and I still have the bottle. I use it every night on my eyes. A little goes a long way!

I have never used eye creams prior to purchasing this item so I cannot compare it to other brands. I also don’t really have dark eye circles but I have noticed a significant difference ever since I started using this. My eye bags are nonexistent lol and my eyes don’t get puffy! They look bright and alive. I live in Colorado and the weather is VERY dry so I do think this helps with keeping my skin moisturized. It is lightweight and a tiny amount will do the job! It is not sticky and my skin absorbs it quickly.

Whenever I don’t use it, I feel like my face doesn’t look as alive or vibrant. I personally think it functions for me and happy I gave it a try. I would recommend and will repurchase!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025
content:
When applied it left a burning sensation under my eyes. I remember when I used another product with retinal you aren't supposed to put it on your under eyes because of it being a sensitive area. But I went ahead and followed the instructions of use for this product. I also remember that we shouldn't use it daily but stupid me decided to follow the instructions. I don't think I'll be following the instructions again for this one.

If you use this, do not put it under your eyes. The skin around that area is sensitive, and I don't recommend using it daily like it says. Use it at least two (2) times a week AND use sunscreen when going out because of the use of retinal you can get sunburnt.

title: Beauty of Joseon Calming Serum Green Tea Panthenol Soothing, Moisturizing Sensitive, Acne-Prone, UV Irritated Skin, Daily Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2024
content:
I ordered this calming green tea serum after using up the small trial size I had from their set.

This is a very lightweight serum. I would almost call it an essence. I use this as one of my first steps after cleansing and toning.

I have Type 1 Rosacea, and this doesn't irritate my skin, and it does feel calming to my skin. Does it take away redness?--it may somewhat, but it does help to calm it before I go on to the rest of my skincare.

This along with their glow serums give my face that nice healthy glow. Not the greasy or oily 'faux glow' that some serums give, but a real healthy glow.

I also like their ginseng cleansing oil and their ginseng essence water.

BOJ is so gentle - no fragrances - cruelty-fee; just a lovely brand!

UPDATE:
When I ran out of this serum, I tried a couple of others including Skin1004 and PURITO, which I must report neither got the job done for me the way this Beauty of Joseon Calming serum did. I have combination skin that varies from resilient to sensitive depending on the seasons, but no matter what, is always red. I use half a dropper full of this BoJ Calming serum and I’m good all day. They may as well rename it “redness be gone”! Definitely stocking up on it, and never going back to the others!

date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
content: I got this becuase my face has been breaking out a lot this summer. I've used this consistently for about 3 weeks now and i've seen such huge improves in my skin's texture and complextion. I pat this on my skin after i wash my face and then i layer it with a light moisturizer and oil. I feel like my skin is supple and bright the next day! It reduces my blemishs but it doesnt completely take them away. I love the texture of this product and i love that it has no scent. I have eczema as well and it doesn't flare it up. I think this is a pretty affordable serum so I think it's worth trying as long as you stay consistent so you can see the results :)

title: Beauty of Joseon Calming Serum Green Tea Panthenol Soothing, Moisturizing Sensitive, Acne-Prone, UV Irritated Skin, Daily Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
content:
Let me start by saying I never leave reviews!!! I have always had sensitive skin. I have battled eczema and rashes that no doctor could diagnose. About 6 years ago I constantly had the rash in the last photo on and off. It burned and itched and felt like I had hundreds of blisters on my face. My dermatologist prescribed me steroids and steroid creams (not great because it thins your skin out over time). I’ve done extensive allergy tests with no answer to what causes this.

I just turned 32 and desperately want to be a skincare girly. But the only things I could use on my face were okay sensitive face wash and Aveeno baby lavender lotion! Anything else has caused me to have a reaction. Even makeup wipes would send my skin into a frenzy and I’d end up at the doctors office.

I’ve been doing research and wanted to use things that fellow sensitive skin people have tried with success. Along with reading extensive reviews. I decided to try this product and I am happy to say that I will be purchasing again! There is no stinging, burning or itching of any kind! I mean JUST LOOK AT MY GLOWING SKIN!

title: Beauty of Joseon Calming Serum Green Tea Panthenol Soothing, Moisturizing Sensitive, Acne-Prone, UV Irritated Skin, Daily Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
content:
Very nice serum with Green Tea. If you dont have any allergy to the ingredients below, its just perfect.

Ingredients overview
Camellia Sinensis Leaf Water (50.9%), Artemisia Capillaris Extract (30%), Panthenol (5%)
, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Water, 1,2-Hexanediol, Methylpropanediol, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Tromethamine, Coptis Japonica Root Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Betaine, Allantoin, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glyceryl Acrylate/Acrylic Acid Copolymer, Polyquaternium-51, Malt Extract, Punica Granatum Extract, Clitoria Ternatea Flower Extract, Garcinia Mangostana Peel Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate

title: Beauty of Joseon Calming Serum Green Tea Panthenol Soothing, Moisturizing Sensitive, Acne-Prone, UV Irritated Skin, Daily Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml 1 fl.oz

title: Beauty of Joseon Calming Serum Green Tea Panthenol Soothing, Moisturizing Sensitive, Acne-Prone, UV Irritated Skin, Daily Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
content: I have sensitive oily acne-prone skin with a lot of redness, burning, and itchiness from tretinoin and other product irritation. First I tried centella-based products, but my skin didn't love them, so I looked for something different. As soon as I used this watery serum my face stopped burning and felt super moisturized even though the serum is really light. Very calming and soothing. content:
This Beauty of Joseon serum comes in a clear bottle and the serum itself is translucent and colorless.

It has a thick but lightweight texture that's like a watery gel. It absorbs quickly and doesn't leave a sticky residue.

For those new to serum, they are thicker in texture than toners and essences. If you have a multi-step skincare routine, applying essence or booster always comes after you've used cleanser, toner and essence, but before applying lotions/creams.

It's made in Korea.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

And yall, speaking of retinol - stop buying it

I promise it works amazingly.

content: I’ve been using this for a few weeks now and I can’t say enough good things about it. title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
content: Okay, I have to admit - this red bean pore mask was pretty amazing! While I can’t say it did wonders on my blackheads and/or pores (since I haven’t used it long enough yet to comment on), what did work was on an angry pimple I had smack dab on the forehead. I have combo skin and endless blackheads but rarely do I get pimples. If I happen to get a blemish, it’ll get zapped with Neutrogena Rapid Clear Acne Spot Gel before it becomes anything larger. This particular pimple I had was an angry one which given a bit of time became pus-filled. Since I had this mask in my arsenal, I decided to give it a shot. It definitely brought the white pus to the surface which left me with no choice but to drain it - all this while instantly brightening up my face and leaving me with a gorgeous glow. This mask and that of Beauty of Joseon’s honey oatmeal version worked beautifully in conjunction on my skin and with solving this pimple. I used the latter a day later to calm down the inflammation and in no time, the dark spot left from the pimple was dissolved. Sure, there’s still a remnant left of a dark spot but I’ll continue busting the issue with these two masks and I have high hopes it’ll take care of the minor mark. This only took me two days to resolve - red bean pore mask on one day and the honey oatmeal mask on another. That’s quite the track record and I wasn’t expecting any promising results at all! Highly, highly recommend.

title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
content:
I really don't like to write reviews even when I run into awful or excellent products. But this mask was such an amazing purchase, maybe even the best skin product I even bought.

First of all I have an extremely oily skin with large pores. It's also prone to hormonal acne especially during my pms. I've been using this mask for 2 weeks and I can see the results already. My skin is much less oily and my pores look smaller for the first time ever. I have tried to shrink my pores with niacinamide serums, tretinoin and other similar products but had no success until now. Also, my skin is hydrated and has a very nice, healthy glow. I'm impressed. I'll keep buying this mask from now on.

title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
content:
So this is our extremely oily skin. This is not for combination. Skin does not work that well on it. If your skin is oily due to make up, this is not the product for you. I use this to minimize my pores.. it works, wonders it leaves my skin, soft and moisturized without the oily shine that I normally have. It lasts for an extremely long amount of time for the size of the container. I am happy with the product. I have been using their products for a while. I am 38 years old and I have always had extremely oily skin. I didn’t buy this because of TikTok. I bought this because I was looking for something that would help remove oil.
So I’ve read on some of the reviews people say that it smells bad. I think it smells like bean paste. It doesn’t really have a clay texture because I also have clay masks, and I can feel the difference at the texture. For me, it does not sting my face unlike when I do my clay mask with apple cider vinegar. I can feel that one tightening my face. This one is a soothing oil remover that I sometimes forget I have on my face. I can walk around my whole house with it on and wash it off after 10 minutes sometimes I leave it on longer cause like I said I forget that it’s there.
I would recommend this every single time. I have my I would never recommend this for someone who has dry skin or normal skin cause this would probably dry you out so much that it would cause you to get more acne.
So I will emphasize to definitely know your skin type.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2024
content:
Came just like the pictures. I recently started using it and I’ve got to say, it leaves your skin hydrated and smooth. I only left it on for like 10-15min, and then washed it off, and still saw good results. It’s not sticky, but it has several small black dots that are a bit uncomfortable to wash off (nothing serious tho).
It comes with it’s own tiny spatula.
I believe quality and quantity wise, the price is perfect. You’re supposed to apply it, I think it’s between 2-3 times a week, and the amount you need to put on your face to see results is small, so I’m expecting it to last several months.
Note: It’s a bit messy to use 😅 It’s easier to apply with a silicone brush or the tiny spatula it comes with, than with your hands.

title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2024
content:
The Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Refreshing Pore Mask is an absolute gem for anyone looking to detoxify their skin while maintaining hydration. As someone with oily skin, I’m always on the lookout for products that purify without leaving my skin feeling stripped, and this mask delivers perfectly.

The formula is enriched with red bean extract, which is known for its antioxidant properties. The texture is smooth with a gentle, grainy consistency—enough to provide light exfoliation but not so rough that it irritates. Applying it feels like a mini spa experience; the mask spreads easily and has a natural, earthy scent that’s soothing without being overwhelming.

I left it on for about 10 minutes, during which it didn’t dry out uncomfortably like some clay masks do. Washing it off was easy, and I loved the slight scrubbing effect as I rinsed. The results were immediate—my skin felt clean, refreshed, and soft, with noticeably minimized pores around my T-zone.

What I appreciate most is that, unlike many pore-focused masks, it didn’t leave my skin tight or dry. Instead, my face felt balanced, as if it had just hit the reset button.

This mask is perfect for weekly use, especially if you’re dealing with congestion or dullness. The Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Mask combines tradition with modern skincare needs beautifully, making it a must-try for anyone seeking gentle yet effective pore care.

title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
content: I have used this mask for few times now makes my skin feels softer & glowy. Smells so good. Helps to make the skin moisturize & makes glowy skin appearance. Quality is awesome. Highly recommended guys if you are thinking of buying it just go for it.

title: Beauty of Joseon Red Bean Pore Refreshing Mask Mud Cream Hydrating Wash Off Pack, Pore Cleansing Exfoliator, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women 140ml, 4.73 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
content:
It’s taken me awhile to find a face mask I like. I took a chance on this one - I was skeptical of the beads - but they were extremely soft and non-abrasive like the apricot scrubs, etc. The mask came with a spatula (smaller than imagined, but it’s the perfect size) most masks don’t come with one so that was bonus points already! It went on so smoothly & didn’t burn or irritate my skin. I left it on for 13 minutes & it seemed to work great, I might try 14 minutes next time. It washed off pretty easily, the beads were did come off into the sink but easily washed away. The best part…. It didn’t make my skin feel dry or tight once I washed it off! I got busy for about ten minutes after taking it off and my skin didn’t feel tight AT ALL.

Also, my biggest pores are in between my eyebrows but generally my t-zone. I’m not kidding when I say they were visibly smaller afterwards. Not completely “gone” obviously but significantly smaller. I felt so clean after. 10000000/10 I love this mask so far!

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2023
content:
This is some nice, good quality, moisturizer. Not too thick, not too thin. Smells nice. Fragrance is almost the most important thing to me. The description of the scent is accurate - like walking through a cool pine forest with a hint of floral notes... It's subtle and suitable for men and women. It goes on smooth and absorbs well. It's not sticky but my skin feels hydrated.
The issue that took one star away from the rating is the price. Many moisturizers can do the job for a fraction of the price. $25,....really!? I admit I'll miss it when I run out because I love the fragrance, but I wouldn't purchase another bottle. It claims to have anti-aging benefits if used over a long period of time, but who has time for that?

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)

content:

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023
content:
This body cream came giftable and sealed. The container gives a clean look and contains rich cream.
The problem is the smell that makes it unusable for me. When I first tried it on my hand, it smelled nice and I even did not know it had artificial fragrance. 5 minutes later, that nice scent has completely gone and some cheap perfume smell started bothering me. That's when I read the ingredients on the box and realized there listed a perfume.
Before I ordered, I did read the product description which I found totally misleading. When it said "Pine Grove Scent (Concentration 0.5%)", it sounded as if they were natural scent. Turned out that was not the case.
Even after multiple times of washing, the smell was still too strong and gave me a headache.
It was horrible and I would not recommend it to anyone.

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023
content: I like this body cream. It is easy to apply, steadily absorbed and it works well in moisturizing your skin and make your skin feel soft, smooth and hydrated. This body lotion has a unique pleasant scent with a woody notes that is quite different from other typical lotion scents. The scent is relaxing and refreshing. Overall, this is a good body cream lotion for daily use.

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
content:
This cream is lightweight and creamy. It gets absorbed into the skin quickly, leaving the skin feeling soft and silky.

Deeply moisturizes my hands while getting rid of the skin fissures and dryness due to winter weather and over washing.

It does have an overpowering musky scent that I really don't like and it lingers for a long time even after washing the hands multiple times. I've realized it's the strong scent of pine.

Now let's talk about the packaging. The pump does not have an arrow like a standard pump does showing which way to turn to open and close so you're left turning both ways hoping that the pump pops up. It took about 5 minutes of turning to finally figure out that you have to push in the middle of the pump to make it pop up! You'd think for the price that you pay for such a small bottle that they would at least add that to the pump.

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
content:
I can smell a hint of pine, and it’s great – until it’s overwhelmed by some other scent. I’m assuming this is the “earthy woodsy” scent, but it smells almost like baby powder to me and is kind of off-putting. It is very light and hydrating, very easy to spread on and lasts all day. If I saw this in a standalone shop and got the chance to smell it first, I’d give it a pass. Scents are very personal things though and this probably smells perfectly amazing for many others out there.

INGREDIENTS:
Water,Glycerin, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Macadamia Integrifolia Seed Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Octyldodecanol, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Cetearyl Olivate, Pentylene Glycol, Polyglyceryl-3 Methylglucose Distearate, Sorbitan Olivate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, Juglans Nigra (Black Walnut) Leaf Extract, Pinus Densiflora Leaf Extract, Sophora Japonica Leaf Extract, Trichosanthes Kirilowii Root Extract, Chamaecyparis Obtusa Water, Pinus Sylvestris Leaf Extract, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Extract, Hippophae Rhamnoides Fruit Extract, Bambusa Vulgaris Water, Cupressus Sempervirens Leaf Extract, Pinus, Sylvestris Bud Extract, Paeonia Suffruticosa Root Extract, Gaultheria Procumbens (Wintergreen) Leaf Extract, Prunus Persica (Peach Flower Extract, Pinus Pinaster Bark Extract, Anemarrhena Asphodeloides Root Extract, Methyl Trimethicone, Vinyl Dimethicone, Vinyl Dimethicone/Methicone Silsesquioxane Crosspolymer, Butylene Glycol, Propanediol, Palmitic Acid, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Ammonium, Acryloyldimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Cellulose Gum, Sodium Phytate, Tocopherol, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Methylpropanediol, Dipropylene Glycol, C12-16 Alcohols, Stearyl Alcohol, Xanthan Gum, Fragrance(Parfum)

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
content: This is one of the best body moisturizers I’ve used, and I’ve tried many throughout the years. It has a silky-smooth texture and feels sufficiently nourishing without being sticky or greasy or taking too long to sink in. The scent is just divine. Personally, I’m very adverse to overly sweet scents and find them quite sickening. This moisturizer isn't very sweet and smells like a pine forest - I really can’t get enough of it. It’s one of the few free Vine products that I will order again at full price once I run out. It's expensive, but not more so than other high-end moisturizers. The texture, scent and feel of this moisturizer on my legs after shaving is just perfect.

title: Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2023
content:
This review is for Beauty of Joseon Pine Grove : Body Cream (400ml, 13.5 fl.oz)

Very fragrant floral pine scent. The cream is thick and comes in a pump bottle. It is moisturizing, but personally I'm not a huge fan of the pine scent. Fragrance wise it is so strong that it can double as perfume if you put some on your wrist or your neck area.

I had a hard time with the pump when I tried to loosen it. I turned it so many times and it wouldn't come up. Eventually I turned it while pulling up and it seemed to work. Don't ask me which way I turned it tho lol.

It is a nice and thick body cream that does moisturize the body, however, due to the extreme scent, it's not for me. But if you like the floral pine scent and don't mind the fragrance, I say try it out!

content:

title: Beauty of Joseon Light On Serum Vitamin C Centella Dark Spot Fine Lines Pigmentation Correcting Serum, Hydrating Moisturizer, Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 30ml, 1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2024
content:
There are a ton of vitamin c skincare products out there. This is perfect for the novice to vitamin c skincare. Vitamin c is known for its collagen boosting and brightening properties. However, it can be irritating to skin. This product is wonderful for many reasons. First, the packaging is opaque and closed. Very important because vitamin c is very unstable, exposure to light and air can cause it to become inactive very quickly. If a vitamin c product has transparent packaging and/or the entire product is exposed upon opening, pass on it. Waste of your money. It will discolor and be unstable in no time and be pointless to apply. Second, the percentage of vitamin c is appropriate for beginners or sensitive skin. The type of vitamin c used in this product (ethyl ascorbic acid) is very stable as well. It is less likely to become inactive quickly and is gentle on skin. In contrast, L-ascorbic acid the pure form of vitamin c is more effective for results but is very unstable and can be harsh/irritating on sensitive skin. The centella that is also in this product is calming which is another bonus for sensitive type skin. The consistency is gel like and pumps out well from the packaging. I use two pumps after toner and before spf in the AM on my face and neck. Always use spf after applying your vitamin c skincare. This serum has no scent. Skincare is no place for fragrances! The product absorbs quickly and is not tacky. I apply a 30 spf after it is absorbed then my sheer foundation. The serum does well under foundation and does not feel tacky or cause a congested feel to my skin. Vitamin c takes several weeks to make noticeable changes to your skin. Give the ingredient time to work. Start low and slow with vitamin c. Low referring to the percentage and slow referring to the frequency it is introduced to your skin. I have used this product for four weeks and have seen some improvements to dark spots/acne scars as well as the brightness of my skin. I will probably venture to a product with a higher percentage of vitamin c after I finish this product, since my skin will then be accustomed to vitamin c.

Update: I used up this product in about three months, that is with two pumps in the AM. The packaging is wonderful in that I don’t feel like much (if any!) product is left over after the pump doesn’t dispense the serum anymore. I noticed an overall brightening and lightening of some dark spots during my three month use.

title: Beauty of Joseon Dynasty Cream Hydrating Face Moisturizer for Dry with Glow Serum Propolis and Niacinamide Hydrating Facial Soothing Moisturizer
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024
content: To start. these are authentic products from beauty of Joseon. As a Korean with eczema, this duo really helps moisturize my extremely dry skin. It's just a cherry on top that it leaves you glowing afterwards. I'm lazy and do not re-apply throughout the day, but I've found that this will last you just fine if you apply once at night after your shower and facial cleanse. My routine for the past few weeks has been the following: double cleanse with Manyo cleansing oil and foam duo in the shower (like I said, I'm lazy so without getting my face wet, I rub with the oil for 30 sec, emulsify, then wash off. Then with my wet face I apply the foam and then rinse and complete the rest of my shower). Once I get out, I dry my face and have only been using this serum and moisturizer (probably should be using toner and whatnot but this has been fine for me. My skin has never been better). After all this my face is left soft and glowey without being greasy.

content:

title: Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Cleansing Oil Waterproof Makeup Remover for Sensitive, Acne-Prone Facial Skin. Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 210ml, 7.1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2024
content:
It really drives me crazy to read the reviews that describe people breaking out after using this face wash. It’s oil — Duh! If you’re acne prone, use it for double cleansing with something else that treats acne (salicylic acid or benzoyl perioxide face wash). Wash with oil first; rinse; then use acne wash. I made the mistake of not double cleansing the first time I used this and, of course, developed a pimple within the day. This product has coconut oil and I’ve always broken out if I leave raw coconut oil on my skin.

The smell, to me, is that of Tea Tree Oil but I don’t see any in the ingredients. I do agree that soybean oil is a cheap byproduct and that, if there’s a heavy scent in the product, that perhaps they are trying to hide a rancid oil smell.

Otherwise, I actually very much liked this product prior to reading the nasty reviews!

title: Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Cleansing Oil Waterproof Makeup Remover for Sensitive, Acne-Prone Facial Skin. Korean Skin Care for Men and Women, 210ml, 7.1 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
content:
Edit: Okay, so I have decided to edit after a few days of using this cleansing oil, and give it the other ⭐, because I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this product! Since writing my first review, I have discovered just how beautiful this cleansing oil really is. I wipe my face with warm water on a makeup wash cloth, put a couple of pumps of the oil in my hand, and just drip a few drops of warm water onto the oil in my hand, and immediately, it starts to turn like...creamy and white - not a frothy foam, but like milk in my hands. Then, I massage the creamy oil into my skin, and it doesn't really lather, so much as it seems to just become no longer oily. When I wipe it away, it leaves my skin just so...CLEAN and soft, but not feeling like it has stripped my face of all moisture like my benzoyl peroxide face wash does. It's bouncy and dewy and smooth. The other up side is that I don't have to wash my under eye areas separately with a gentle cleanser (I was using baby shampoo before buying this cleanser, and washing it first so that I didn't get benzoyl peroxide into my delicate under eye areas, which would have dried it out and caused worse fine lines). I can use this oil to gently wash my under eye area with my finger tips and to wash off my eye makeup if I'm wearing any, because it is so gentle and it adds moisture, instead of taking it away. My skin hasn't looked this good in decades - if EVER! I'm 41, and my skin looks better than it did at 31...or 21 for that matter, because for the first time in I can't remember when, I have ZERO blemishes, and - TMI, but: I'm in that point in my cycle when I'm usually having the worst breakouts, but not a single pimple or blackhead or bump of any kind. NOTHING has done so much for my skin as this oil has. Not retinol, not salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide not an expensive cream or serum - nothing!

I used to DREAD washing my face, because I had to take care not to get any under my eyes or on my neck, and had to thoroughly get all of it off when rinsing, etc, but this cleansing oil has turned my least favorite part of my skin care routine into my FAVORITE part! And I no longer dislike the smell; I now associate it with the lovely experience. I WILL be reordering! I'm even contemplating buying one to use in the shower! Seriously.

If you are interested in trying an oil-based face wash, but you're an oily or combination skin type, THIS is the one to try! It's now ESSENTIAL to my skin care routine. Did I say I LOVE it?!

Original review: So, first of all, I'm VERY impressed with the shipping. I ordered it after 11am, and it was on my porch by 4. Having two toddlers and no time to leave the house, that is just VERY convenient.

On to its quality: it feels very light and left my skin feeling clean and soft, and did not make me greasy. I did enjoy the spa-like feeling, too. It wiped clean with just warm water and a microfiber towel that's made for makeup removal.

However, my biggest issue is with the smell. It stinks. BUT, as a girl who grew up on the border of Appalachia and the Midwest, I recognize that smell: it's ginseng. While I don't usually desire scents in my skin care products, I would probably have approved of some modification of the smell of this particular product. That said, I'm going to continue using it BECAUSE of the ginseng and its antioxidant properties...but I'll probably follow it up with a toner that DOESN'T stink. lol

I'm an oily skin girl, and so far I don't think it's going to make things worse - especially since I'm still in the 6-8 week retinol purge, so not much CAN make it worse...ugh! AND my skin probably needs the addition of oil to prevent any dryness retinol may cause later on down the road.

I'm going to use this product up, and I'll decide when it gets close to empty whether or not I'm going to reorder. So far, so good. Excellent price for what you get too, so if you're looking for an effective oil cleanser that isn't just canola or coconut oil that will leave you greasy, this is the one.

Time will tell, and I'll be back - good or bad.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024
content:
I’ve used this cleansing oil for almost a year as I bought multiple bottles initially.
Pros: it works well as a gentle cleanser and does not dry out/strip your skin (as you would expect with a cleansing oil).
Affordable and lasts a very long time.

Cons: I mainly bought it to do the heavy lifting with removing my makeup and it did not do such a great job. I had to either cleanse with this oil twice to remove majority of the makeup followed by a different cleanser or micellar water or use more of the micellar water if using it once. Also if you use it heavily on your eyes, it would sting. For reference, I don’t use a lot of make up just tinted moisturizer, mascara and blush/bronzer.
It does have an added fragrance, but it does have a scent (maybe the natural scent of the ginseng oil) that kind of reminded me of gasoline, which I really disliked.

Personally for me, I won’t be purchasing it again.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2024
content:
I have normal skin that doesn't get oily or dry, if I treat it well :), and even though I know rice is usually better for oily skin, I wanted to give it a try as I have a bit of acne that might benefit from it. 5-ish fl oz is a good size, and it lasted me a little less than 2 months before the bottle got empty.

I adore the smell of real rice wine, and it feels so authentically Korean especially in the packaging, as does BOJ's brand itself. The rice wine smell is very natural smelling, and reminds me of when fermented rice water for hair and your face was super viral on youtube, pinterest, etc. a few years ago, which I really like and appreciate. This is what sets it apart from the other rice toners imo, that it's made of fermented rice.

The advertising campaign with the rice mask has been on point, and totally convinced me to try the two lol. As for the performance, it leaves a finish that is matte (maybe tacky?) to the touch, but leaves a subtle glow on my cheeks, which makes sense, as rice and kaolin clay absorb oil. When I soak a cotton pad and leave it on my face for 30 minutes it provides nice hydration and is comparable to using real rice wine as a sheet mask.

Overall: This would definitely be able to do what it's supposed to on oilier skin than mine, but I have really enjoyed it nevertheless. It's not magic, but I think this is a really unique product, and I will repurchase as I absolutely love the sophisticated scent :)

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
content:
I bought this product at the beginning of the launch, not really knowing what skin type it's best used for. After using it sporadically for a few months, I've come to the conclusion it wasn't for me.

I have dry, combination skin, which can get oily during summertime, but still ends up drying if I don't apply adequate moisture. I was hoping this product would help remedy that issue: delivering moisture and hydration while also controlling oil. Unfortunately, my skin ended up drying out often after applying this product, and a few times it felt like it was irritating my skin, especially around the nose area. I do like the mattifying effect it initially gave me, but the feeling of dryness was a tad bit overwhelming.

As usual, the packaging is minimalistic and attractive, and I do believe the ingredients are of good quality, but unfortunately it just did not work out for me. Overall, I give this product a 3 out of 5. I would not repurchase for myself, but for my oily skin girlies? Perhaps this might work for you.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2024
content:
I've been using the Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for about a month now, and honestly, I'm so glad I found this gem. I have oily-combination skin, and finding a toner that balances my skin without making it feel greasy has always been a struggle. This toner, though, has been a game-changer.

The first thing I noticed was how light and refreshing it feels. It's not heavy or sticky like some toners, which is a huge plus for me. After using it consistently, I can genuinely see a difference in how balanced my skin looks. My T-zone isn’t as oily by midday, and my skin feels softer, more hydrated, but never greasy.

What I love the most is the fact that it contains rice extract, which adds a subtle glow without clogging my pores or feeling too rich. It feels like my skin is being nourished, not suffocated. And the fact that it’s a Korean skincare product just makes it even better because I’ve always had great experiences with K-beauty products. They just seem to get how to cater to different skin types.

If you have oily or combination skin and you’re looking for something that will keep your skin balanced while still giving you that healthy glow, I can’t recommend this toner enough. It’s honestly been a lifesaver for my skin, and I can see myself using this for a long time. It feels like one of those rare products that really deliver on what they promise!

content:
Milky toner has become really popular all over social media. I had tried a couple of the most popular/most recommended ones, but was never that impressed. I thought they left my skin feeling tacky … and then I found Beauty of Joseon. I love this brand. I have loved everything I had tried (this includes the Relief Sun!) A little toner goes a long way. 10/10 recommend.
I have combination, acne prone skin, and don’t wear a ton of makeup day-to-day. Also, I did purchase directly from Beauty of Joseon‘s website.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024
content:
This toner has a smooth LUXURIOUS feel on the skin. It's not watery and can be easily applied via cotton pad. It has a light scent to it that reminds me of rice. It is fresh and not overpowering.

After applying, my skin felt calmed and less red. Over time, it helped smooth the texture of my skin. It plays well with other skincare and, collaborates well with the matching RICE and HONEY glow mask. It is hydrating and gentle on the skin.

I am happy with it and reach for it often. I recommend you look into this effective toner.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
content: Shake well before use, it separates when sitting still. Came nicely packed with a branded seal on the box and a tinfoil seal on the dispenser hole. It is a watery liquid and has no detectable scent which is nice. I use it directly on my palm and pat it around on my face. I’d put this as a mild toner – you can feel that it’s doing something, while not as useless as some I’ve tried, it’s not as overly moisturizing as some others I’ve tried – this is somewhere in the middle. I don’t let it dry on my face before layering other things on top of it, but it doesn’t feel sticky or tacky, and doesn’t dry too fast.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
content:
I really like rice toners in general, so for Beauty of Joseon to offer this product is a plus. Like any other rice toner, you have to shake the bottle well before use. The toner is an off-white color, which is a little different when compared to the "I'm from Rice milky toner" which is a true white. This was an added bonus since I felt like this color is more true to rice water, which means less processing/additives added to make the product a brighter white color.

The rice toner scent did not have any added scent/fragrance (that I could tell), so it smelled like rice water. I've been using it for 3 days now and it works like a charm. The only thing that could be improved is the gritty feeling I get on my skin after applying the product. Not sure if this is residual rice remnants, but it's not so noticeable that I would stop using it.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
content:

I couldn't find any instructions about how to use this in a facial routine other than to apply after cleaning. I clean, apply this product and then add a moisturizer and a sunscreen when I go out.

title: Beauty of Joseon Glow Replenishing Rice Facial Sebum Toner for Oily Combination Skin Korean Moisturizing Balance Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
content:
As a woman of “a certain age” I guess it’s time to start taking care of what I’ve been given! I have pretty good skin overall, especially for an old lady of 54, but there a few areas I’d like to diminish (mainly my waistline but, sadly, this isn’t the right product for that!).

This product separates so I give it a good shake first; I’ve been using this with a cotton ball and a little goes a long way - I used way too much product the first time. A few drops is really all I need - and you can always use more if needed. I haven’t noticed any fragrance and my skin feels soft and moist after using, the perfect canvas for whatever serums I choose to use next.

It’s hard to speak to the effectiveness because if it’s something you're already using it’s hard to notice a difference if the product is comparable. However, if it’s something new, it usually takes a while for any real benefits to show up. I haven’t noticed any issues or changes yet but, if that changes over time, I’ll update my review accordingly.

Thank you for reading my review, I hope it was helpful!

content:
Edited review because BoJ refunded my order due to the poor reaction. However, please note if you have sensitive skin as indicated below.

The first time I used this mask, it was lovely - a very mild honey smell, left my skin feeling very soft afterwards. A few weeks later, I applied this mask and was shocked when my skin felt like it was burning within 1 minute. title: Beauty of Joseon Ground Rice and Honey Glow Mask Pore Sebum Care for Dry Sensitive Skin Korean Skin Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2024
content:
The Beauty of Joseon Ground Rice and Honey Glow Mask is a fantastic addition to any skincare routine, especially for those with dry or sensitive skin. Its blend of ground rice and honey provides gentle exfoliation while deeply nourishing the skin, leaving it soft, radiant, and hydrated. The mask is lightweight and non-irritating, making it suitable for even the most sensitive skin types.

The 150ml size offers great value for regular use, and its natural ingredients align with the brand's commitment to traditional Korean skincare methods. While it’s an excellent product, the thick texture might take some effort to rinse off completely. Despite this minor inconvenience, it’s a luxurious and effective mask that deserves a glowing 5-star rating!
