title: Beauty of Joseon Ground Rice and Honey Glow Mask Pore Sebum Care for Dry Sensitive Skin Korean Skin Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024
content:
I want to be transparent in my review by saying a couple days before this, I did start using Cosrx Snail Mucin 96% serum too, which I feel like also helped a lot (for the picture I attached, doesn't really affect my review I don't think!).
I have to be very careful about products that I put on my face because my skin is very sensitive and I have eczema so I am allergic to a lot of stuff and I can't always tell when it will happen. Also my skin is very, very dry (I use queen Helene cocoa butter in the tub as face lotion) because of my eczema so anything that strips skin even a little bit or damages moisture barrier is a huge no. It's gotta be very gentle. I was really satisfied with this product! I feel like it helped give me that "lit from within" glowy look. My skin actually doesn't feel irritated. One reason I wanted to switch to a tub was to limit the environmental damage from sheet masks.

One thing that I was concerned about was I have done masks like this before and they dry hard and unpleasant feeling, but this one wasn't like that at all. After about the 20 or so minutes, it was still the same texture, still wet and not uncomfortable at all. Like others have said, it does smell like baby food, I would say almost like banana oatmeal baby food, but it's not unpleasant.

I feel like it's a good value for money and will go a long way. Included with it was a little spoon for applying and a spoonful was maybe around a dime size maybe. I think I used 4 of them to do a layer. I'm confident that, using this mask 2-3 times a week, it will last quite a while.

I really liked it, it felt refreshing, seemed to do my skin good and seems like a good value, so I would recommend it!

title: Beauty of Joseon Ground Rice and Honey Glow Mask Pore Sebum Care for Dry Sensitive Skin Korean Skin Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2024
content: I experienced no skin irritation - I got this on sale my skin is a little sensitive so I knew it was a 50/50 chance of upsetting it. Shockingly I noticed my pores seemed smaller after one usage?? Maybe I’m experiencing a placebo affect but I swear they looked smaller…. Interesting smell. Due to quick results I really think it’s a good value. I didn’t notice any really glowy affects , just pore shrinking which honestly is better! I didn’t notice any stickiness despite honey being an ingredient , cooling and feels nice to apply. I really like it so far! Even if the pore results are the only I see - it would still be 100% worth the money!

title: Beauty of Joseon Ground Rice and Honey Glow Mask Pore Sebum Care for Dry Sensitive Skin Korean Skin Care 150ml, 5.07 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2024
content:
Update: I’ve had this for almost two months and while I didn’t use this mask often, I definitely do once a week. I am increasing the rating to 5 stars because of its magical ability in solving breakouts (which I did not expect whatsoever). Sure it mentioned this mask could calm down inflammation but what I didn’t know was when a recent angry pimple surfaced up with white pus smack dab on my forehead - I hesitantly gave this mask a shot. Unbeknownst to me, it immediately removed the redness post-mask and I kid you not - in a day or so, the pus was gone and so was the pimple altogether. It was as if nothing has occurred. I am beyond blown away by this unassuming miracle worker and all this time I’ve been utilizing a Neutrogena spot acne gel when I could be using this mask instead. And it could instantly brighten your skin to a radiant glow while combatting pimples?? Sign me up. I’ll forever purchase this product. Beauty of Joseon, you’ve outdone yourself. 👏👏

Original: I’m glad to have encountered Beauty of Joseon’s products on Amazon, otherwise I would not have known about this mask as well as their other products. I owned this ground rice/honey mask and also their red bean pore version. Since this is a new purchase, I’ve only used it a couple of times at the moment. The mask smelled like homemade oatmeal and I find it soothing and comforting. While I can’t say this has helped my blackheads and pores after a few usage, what I can say was the instant glowing effect was blatantly obvious. If that’s what you’re looking for to brighten up dull skin, this is a mask for you. My face is naturally soft to the touch, so I can’t say it’s made it more soft. I purchased this in hopes it’ll help with the appearance of shrinking pores and most of all - lessening of my blackheads. I suppose it’s a tall order since I haven’t found a viable solution yet - not even after all these years, but one can remain hopeful, right?

title: Beauty of Joseon Daily Relief Sunscreen for face Sun moisturizing with Broad Spectrum SPF 40 Korean sunscreen skincare 50ml, 1.69 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2025
content: This version is a reformulation to comply with the FDA. It is sub-par compared to the original Korean formulation and was created specifically for sales in the US. The last time the FDA approved a new active ingredient for sunscreens was 1999. We are far behind as compared to Europe and Asia in formulating better, safer sunscreen ingredients. Purchase the original Korean formulations of sunscreens on sites such as Stylevana and Olive & Young, which ships authentic products from Korea and/or Europe.

title: Beauty of Joseon Daily Relief Sunscreen for face Sun moisturizing with Broad Spectrum SPF 40 Korean sunscreen skincare 50ml, 1.69 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2025
content: I was kind of skeptical about using this because it was very hyped on Tiktok and I can never tell if those people are telling the truth because they receive commission. But I would say this worked pretty well! It made my skin look so nice and it would leaves glowing effect. My BROTHER of all people even complimented me and said my skin looks glowing and asked what I did. I highly recommend because another great thing is that if you accidentally get it in your eye when washing your face and putting your head under running water, the product could get in your eye of course. But it doesn't sting when that happens which is really nice. Other spf that I have used in the past have always STUNG my eyes so bad but I barely had issues with this one. Overall, korean skincare is a gamechanger and has so many benefits and not as many harsh chemicals like other products do. I would suggest looking into it and also purchasing this spf!

content: I bought this thinking it was the Korean sunscreen formula, not knowing that the fda won’t allow the company to see that particular one anymore. This American formula is just not the same. It’s MUCH thicker, it’s doesn’t have that moisturizing feeling. It makes my face feel very greasy after wards. It has that sunscreen smell to it, which the Korean version does not. AND it’s 10 less spf than the Korean version. I was very disappointed when this came in because I didn’t realize the formula available in the us had changed

title: Beauty of Joseon Daily Relief Sunscreen for face Sun moisturizing with Broad Spectrum SPF 40 Korean sunscreen skincare 50ml, 1.69 fl.oz
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2024
content: I’m one of the customers who thought they’d reordered the original sunscreen, but got a different version the second time around. I obviously loved the first one and was skeptical when what I squeezed out was slightly thicker and smelled a bit more like sunscreen. It’s feels more moisturizing, but not in any way sticky and leaves no white cast. Once dry it feels exactly the same as the original, and I can do my usual routine after without any visible difference. I don’t use any foundation though, just JR Miracle Balm for my dry skin. While I don’t necessarily think that it’s okay to just spring something else on people I’m not too upset because I like this version too.
